description: Study of important types of reactions and functional groups, with emphasis on synthetic usefulness, mechanisms, and stereoelectronic principles.
name: ORGANIC MECHANISMS STRUC

values.comments:
Advanced Organic Chemistry: Reactions, Mechanisms, and Stereoelectronic
Effects covers the study of important types of reactions and functional groups, with
emphasis on synthetic usefulness, mechanisms, and stereoelectronic principles.
Students typically did not have strong feelings either way about this course. One
noted that the “material is very interesting,” while another commented that the textbooks
were “confusing and difficult to read.” One student also noted that this course is “very
similar to CHEM 443,” and they are “worth taking together because they complement
each other quite nicely, but [are] not really worth taking separately.”
Students had mixed views of Dr. Kozlowski. While one student described her as
“very knowledgeable,” another found her to be “quite abrasive” to students and an
ineffective teacher when working out problems on the board. One also expressed
wishing that Dr. Kozlowski “spent more time explaining the logic” behind the problems
because they were difficult to follow during class and required significant individual
effort to understand outside of class.
This course requires Chemistry 242 as a prerequisite. While it’s not specified as a
prerequisite, one student noted that “lab experience is necessary to take this course.”
Another commented that the “course moves quickly” and that some concepts are difficult
to understand.
*Seven students submitted reviews for this course.
